alert.note: Alert for Interior Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 4:03AM EST until January 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A brief period of heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches expected. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In New Hampshire, Interior Rockingham County. In Maine, Coastal Cumberland and Coastal York Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Roads will become snow covered and slippery. Intense snowfall rates will make for worse driving conditions than usual, and a switch to rain will make remaining snow covered roads even more slippery. Strong winds may cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snowfall rates are anticipated, with rates of 1 to 3 inches per hour expected at times. The snow is then expected to change to rain during the late morning and early afternoon. Clogged storm drains may lead to ponding of water on roadways once precipitation changes to rain. Cold and windy conditions return Monday night and Tuesday with low wind chill values developing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to www.weather.gov/gray..
